Key to Orders of Nematodes: Esophagus cylindrical or bottle-shaped; amphids usually post-labial; excretory system single-cell hypodermal glands; male usually with 2 testes; caudal alae rare; phasmids absent
Esophagus often subdivided into bulbs; amphid apertures on lips, often difficult to see, or posterior to lips and obvious - round or coiled; gonads single or paired in both male and female

Anterior sensillae often in 3 whorls of inner labial papillae, outer labial setae and cephalic setae; metanemes (filamentous structures in lateral chors) present; caudal glands present; esophageal glands open in or near stoma

Anterior sensillae rarely setiform; stoma with teeth or odontostyle; esophagus cylindrical, bottle-shaped or a stichosome; caudal glands usually absent; esophageal glands open in posterior region of esophagus
Spicule protractor muscles attached to proximal enlargement; metanemes present; marine and fresh water
Spicule protractor muscles form a pouch around spicules; protrusible tooth in some forms
Movable hollow spear; esophagus expanded posteriorly - bottle-shaped.
Glandular esophageal stichosome and intestinal trophosome; juveniles are parasites of invertebrates.
Esophagus vestigial; parasites of vertebrates in all life stages
Esophagus cylindrical throughout
Juveniles are parasites of invertebrates; adults free-living
All stages parasitic; adults are vertebrate parasites, juveniles with or without intermediate hosts
All stages free-living
Posterior esophagus a stichosome; onchiostyle present; monovarial; anphids pore-like
Anterior end has a sucker; males with bell-shaped bursa
Strong, large, cuticularized stoma with prominent dorsal tooth; predators of nematodes
Long and slender; tubular stoma without teeth; stoma without lips; soil inhabitants

Amphids usually pore-like, on lips; cephalic sensillae on lip region; phasmids present; caudal glands absent; mainly terrestrial, rarely freshwater or marine; include free-living, animal parasites, plant parsites
Amphids post-labial, varied shapes; phasmids absent; somatic seta common; mainly free-living aquatic organisms

Anterior sensillae in three whorls, inner labial, outer labial and cephalic; amphids var from circular to complex spirals, post-labial and usually posterior to cephalic setae; stoma funnel-shaped with a dorsal tooth and two smaller subventral teeth; esophagus cylindrical with posetrior bulb; females diovarial; mainly marine

Brownish cuticle; anterior sensillae in three whorls, inner labial, outer labial and cephalic; amphids spiral, posterior to cephalic setae; dorsal and smaller subventral teeth; esophagus cylindrical with enlarged end bulb

Anterior sensillae in three whorls, inner labial, outer labial and cephalic, cephalic setae on peduncles; amphids large, on head; ocelli may be present; small stoma with small teeth; esophagus cylindrical; females diovarial; mainly marine
Small, slender nematodes with a slender tail region; three whorls of anterior sensilla; amphids round; both sexes with one or two gonads; Mainly aquatic and wet soil environments

Anterior sensillae in three whorls, inner labial, outer labial and cephalic; stoma with 3 to 6 teeth on anterior edge; amphids loop-shaped; ocelli may be present; esophagus cylindrical with no posterior enlargement
Labial sensilla papilliform, cephalic sensilla usually setiform; qamphids circular or simple spiral; esophagus cylindrical, with or without basal bulb; females usually diovarial
Enoplida; amphids pocket-shaped; esophagus cylindrical; 3 esophageal glands opening in or near stoma; excretory canal present; marine and freshwater
Enoplida; amphids pocket-shaped; stoma elongated, without teeth or with 3-5 moveable teeth; esophagus cylindrical; excretory canal present; mainly marine but also freshwater
Enoplida; amphids pocket-shaped; stoma large, refractive, with 3 teeth; esophagus cylindrical; excretory canal present; mainly marine but also freshwater
Enoplida; amphids spiral; stoma with 1 or more teeth; esophagus cylindrical; females diovarial; mainly marine
Enoplida; amphids pocket-shaped; stoma with dorsal tooth; esophagus cylindrical with terminal bulb; excretory canal present; females diovarial; soil and freshwater inhabitants
Enoplida; amphids pore or pocket-shaped; stoma vestigial, without teeth; esophagus slender, cylindrical, enlarged posteriorly; soil and freshwater inhabitants
Enoplida; amphids spiral; stoma with teeth; esophagus cylindrical; females diovarial; mainly marine, some freshwater
Triplonchida; stoma with curved or complex spear; sensilla papilliform; esophagus with elongate prosterior bulb
Triplonchida; stoma wide and refractive or funnel-shaped; usually with teeth; spinneret at tail tip
Triplonchida; stoma narrow with a dirsal and two small subventral teeth; well-developed caudal glands opening at terminal spinneret
Dorylaimida; stoma with axial odontostyle
Dorylaimida; stoma withgrooved subventral mural tooth
Mononchida; stoma large, wide with 1 to 3 teeth and/or rows of denticles
Mononchida; Stoma narrow with a single subventral tooth
Isolaimiida;
Mermithida;
Trichinellida;
Muscipeicida;
Dioctophymatida;
Marimermithida;
Chromadorida;
Desmodorida;
Monhysterida;
Monhysterida;
Desmoscolecida;
Araeolaimida;
Plectida;
Rhabditida; stoma with a protrusible stomatostyle; lip region simple; posterior esophageal region either a bulb without valve or overlapping glands
Rhabditida; stoma without teeth or with denticles; lip region simple; esophageal corpus without bulb; posterior bulb with valve
Rhabditida; stoma without teeth or with denticles; lip region with probolae; esophageal corpus without bulb; posterior bulb with valve
Rhabditida; stoma with teeth; lip region simple; corpus with muscular metacorpus; no valve in posterior bulb
Rhabditida; stoma without teeth or with denticles; lip region simple; corpus with metacorpus; posterior bulb with valve
Rhabditida; juveniles with cephalic hooks; multinucleate esophageal glands; parasites of animals
